solution_line_template: If Ernie's income is {ernie_income_fraction} of what it used to be, she is earning {ernie_income_fraction}*${ernie_old_income}=${<<{ernie_income_fraction}*{ernie_old_income}={ernie_current_income}>>}{ernie_current_income} now
Jack's income is now twice what Ernie used to make a total of {jack_multiplier}*${ernie_old_income} = ${<<{jack_multiplier}*{ernie_old_income}={jack_current_income}>>}{jack_current_income}
Combined, Ernie and Jack are making ${jack_current_income}+${ernie_current_income} = ${<<{jack_current_income}+{ernie_current_income}={combined_income}>>}{combined_income}
